page.title: 05PENTOWAN POTATO FARM
page.content: No potatoes are grown on this farm; it is a distribution point for 4 other farms in Essex. The farm covers two hectares. Four varieties of potatoes are distributed, they are:- {Desiree,King Edward,Maris Piper,}and { {Pentland Squire.}Potatoes usually produce 14 tonnes to the acre. In the winter the potatoes are stored in large buildings with concrete floors. There are iron or wooden ducts about 30cms deep and air is forced through by a fan, the sides of the building are insulated with straw from the farm. The potatoes are sent to shops and markets in paper sacks each weighing 25 kilos.{Mr.Russell}has 7 lorries and others are hired when needed.Thelorry drivers must not work for more than 10hrs in any 24hrs. The office staff work from 7.30 am to 5.pm.
